column1: STRATEGIC PRIORITIES — WHAT TO BUILD AND WHY

column3: Most tools use black-box scores (Garmin Training Readiness, WHOOP Recovery). Show the math. Build expert users who evangelize.

column2: AI coaching with FULL training context awareness
column3: No AI coach knows your complete history. This is Dreamy's entire reason for existing.
Connecting sleep + weather + shoes + fatigue to explain individual workout outcomes. Nobody does this.
The hybrid athlete (Hyrox, CrossFit Endurance) market is exploding. No tool treats strength and running as equal.

column2: Weather-adjusted performance trending and training load
column3: Everyone annotates weather. Nobody adjusts the actual load/pace calculation for conditions.

column2: Shoe efficiency model with controlled comparison
column3: After isolating confounders: which shoe makes you faster? Currently impossible to answer without a lab.

column2: Personalized recovery model that learns YOUR physiology
column3: Individual recovery varies 3-5x. Population models are wrong for most people.

column2: Race execution analysis with AI grading and recommendations
column3: Post-race analysis is THE highest-engagement coaching moment. Currently underserved.

column2: Adaptive planning that considers life context (not just biometrics)
column3: Busy week + travel + poor sleep should change your plan. Currently no tool does this well.

column2: Pattern recognition → predictive coaching from historical data
column3: 'You PR when CTL is 50-55 and TSB is +5 to +8' → 'Race in the next 10 days'. Unique.
If you don't sync with Strava, you don't exist to 90% of runners.
30%+ of GPS watch market. Non-negotiable.
The minimum viable product.
Every tool shows this.
Standard in every running app.
Strava, Garmin, everyone.
If you can't show a map, you're not a running app.
Some form of structured scheduling.
The basic activity review experience.
Runners check stats on phones.

column2: 10 FEATURES THAT LOOK COOL BUT DON'T MATTER

column3: Inconsistent, not comparable across devices, most runners don't know what to do with it.
Varies wildly between brands/days. False precision on an inherently noisy metric.
Fun but zero training benefit. Niche engagement, not core value.
Cute, not valuable. Don't waste engineering time.
Overwhelms everyone except researchers. No actionable insight for 99% of runners.

column2: Social feed features competing with Strava
column3: You will never out-social Strava. Don't try.
Research shows foot strike type alone doesn't predict injury.
Impressive science but most runners can't act on it.

column2: Full nutrition tracking in a running app
column3: Better done in dedicated apps (MyFitnessPal). Import calories via API if needed.
Strava owns this. Any clone is dead on arrival.
Network effects make this unassailable. Everyone syncs TO Strava. Don't compete — integrate.
Training Readiness, Body Battery, VO2max all require Garmin. 30%+ GPS watch market share.
De facto standard for coached athletes. Coaches' workflows are built around TP. High switching cost.
No direct competitor can replicate their footpod approach. Lock-in via power-based plans.
Any platform with 2+ years of your data has massive switching costs. Favors incumbents.
Every conversation, every workout, every pattern detected makes the AI smarter. Switching means starting over.
6+ months of data creates predictions no other tool can replicate. The longer you use it, the better it gets.
Users who understand their metrics become expert advocates. Trust > lock-in.
Full export at any time. Users stay because Dreamy is BETTER, not because they're trapped.
Not multi-sport, not social, not hardware. The deepest AI running intelligence in the market.
